Key Arguments: The bill positions the government as the sole arbiter of truth, which is problematic as governments and political parties have differing views on truth.
The bill represents an overreach by allowing ACMA and tech companies to police misinformation and disinformation without limits.
Exemptions in the bill imply that the government and mainstream media see themselves as infallible, which is not the case.
The bill threatens freedom of speech, contradicting the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.
The bill could restrict religious expression on various moral and ethical issues.
Notable Quotes: The Combating Misinformation and Disinformation Bill purports that the Government is the sole arbitrer of truth.
The bill is a direct threat to freedom of speech.
Under this bill, people of faith could be restricted, silenced and punished for their views.
